Dwarika Nath College is an undergraduate college located in Jattichak, Masaurhi, in the Patna district of Bihar, India. Established in 1979, it is affiliated with Magadh University.
History
Dwarika Nath College was established on 26 June 1979 in Jattichak, Masaurhi, Patna district. The college was founded through the efforts of local residents, including Sri Dwarika Nath Singh, an executive engineer, and other community members who recognized the need for higher education facilities in the region. Prior to the establishment of the college, there were no institutions offering higher education in the Masaurhi area.
The college received approval from the Government of Bihar for intermediate and bachelor's degree programmes on 6 November 1982. Permanent affiliation for Bachelor of Arts, Science, and Commerce programmes at the honours level was subsequently granted.
Campus
The college is located in front of Masaurhi Court Halt, providing convenient access to road and rail transport for students and staff. The campus includes a playground and green spaces.
Academics
The college offers undergraduate programmes in arts, science, and commerce streams.
Administration
The current principal of the college is Dr Lalit Narayan Singh.
